item.title: 美国对挪威财富基金从卡特彼勒撤资感到 "非常不安
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的政府周三表示，对挪威2万亿美元财富基金从美国建筑设备集团卡特彼勒（Caterpillar）撤资感到 "非常不安"，并补充说华盛顿正就此事与挪威政府直接接触。【原文：President Donald Trump's administration said on Wednesday it was "very troubled" by the divestment by Norway's $2 trillion wealth fund from U.S. construction equipment group Caterpillar , adding Washington was directly engaging with the Norwegian government on the issue.】

item.title: 加州立法者投票决定允许销售含乙醇量更高的燃料
item.description: 加利福尼亚州立法者周三投票决定允许销售一种高乙醇汽油混合物，这将有助于降低美国最大汽车市场的燃油价格。【原文：California lawmakers on Wednesday voted to allow the sale of a higher-ethanol gasoline blend that could help bring down fuel prices in the largest U.S. auto market.】

item.title: 陪审团裁定，谷歌必须在隐私权集体诉讼案中支付 4.25 亿美元
item.description: 原告律师发言人说，联邦陪审团周三裁定，Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司必须在一起集体诉讼案中支付 4.25 亿美元，该诉讼指控谷歌继续收集数百万关闭了谷歌账户跟踪功能的用户的数据。【原文：A federal jury determined on Wednesday that Alphabet's Google must pay $425 million in a class action lawsuit that accused it of continuing to collect data for millions of users who had switched off a tracking feature in their Google account, a spokesperson for the plaintiffs' lawyer said.】

item.title: 新日铁与美国工人联合会、克里夫斯公司就美国钢铁交易达成和解
item.description: 新日铁周三表示，该公司已经解决了与美国钢铁工人联合会（United Steelworkers union）和克利夫兰-克里夫斯钢铁公司（Cleveland-Cliffs）之间的所有法律纠纷，这些纠纷与新日铁斥资 149 亿美元收购美国钢铁公司有关。【原文：Nippon Steel said on Wednesday it has resolved all legal disputes with the United Steelworkers union and steelmaker Cleveland-Cliffs tied to its $14.9 billion acquisition of U.S. Steel, which closed in June.】

item.title: 2024 年和 2025 年全球石油和天然气公司裁员情况
item.description: 国际石油和天然气公司已经宣布，由于油价下跌，并在经历了数十年来该行业最大的并购浪潮后进行整合，他们将在 2024 年和 2025 年裁员数万人。【原文：International oil and gas companies have announced they would cut tens of thousands of jobs in 2024 and 2025 due to lower oil prices and as they consolidate after the biggest wave of mergers and acquisitions in the industry for decades.】

item.title: 惠普服务器需求强劲，季度收入超出预期
item.description: 受服务器和网络部门强劲需求的推动，惠普企业公司周三公布的第三季度营收超出华尔街预期。【原文：Hewlett Packard Enterprise beat Wall Street estimates for third-quarter revenue on Wednesday, driven by strong demand in its server and networking segments.】

item.title: 交易日：科技股反弹，就业忧虑加深
item.description: 交易日【原文：TRADING DAY】

item.title: 法国数据保护机构对谷歌罚款 3.25 亿欧元
item.description: 法国数据保护机构周三表示，已对谷歌处以 3.25 亿欧元（约合 3.81 亿美元）的罚款，原因是谷歌在未经用户同意的情况下向 Gmail 用户显示广告，并在用户设置谷歌账户时使用 cookies。【原文：France's data protection authority said on Wednesday it had fined Google 325 million euros ($381 million) for displaying ads to Gmail users and using cookies when users set up Google accounts both without their consent.】

item.title: 谢因公司被法国数据保护机构罚款 1.5 亿欧元
item.description: 本周三，在线快速时尚零售商 Shein 因不当使用 cookies 被法国数据保护机构罚款 1.5 亿欧元（1.7561 亿美元）。【原文：Online fast-fashion retailer Shein received a 150 million euro ($175.61 million) fine on Wednesday from France's data protection authority over the improper use of cookies, a decision the company contested and said it would appeal.】

item.title: 美国之鹰寄希望于促销活动来预测乐观的销售情况，股价大涨 25
item.description: 美国鹰服装公司（American Eagle Outfitters）周三预测第三季度可比销售额将高于预期，并押注于促销和新产品带来的需求，这使得该服装零售商的股价在收盘后上涨了 25%。【原文：American Eagle Outfitters forecast third-quarter comparable sales above expectations on Wednesday, betting on the demand driven by promotions and new products, sending the shares of the apparel retailer up 25% after the bell.】

item.title: 由于设计软件需求强劲，Figma 预计全年收入将超过预期
item.description: Figma 周三在其作为上市公司的首份财务报告中预测全年收入将超过华尔街预期，凸显了市场对其人工智能设计工具的强劲需求。【原文：Figma on Wednesday forecast full-year revenue above Wall Street expectations in its first financial report as a public company, highlighting strong demand for its artificial intelligence-powered design tools.】

item.title: Salesforce 预测本季度收入疲软，股价下跌
item.description: 商业软件供应商 Salesforce 周三预测第三季度营收低于华尔街预期，原因是宏观经济的不确定性导致客户削减了对其企业云产品的支出。【原文：Business software provider Salesforce forecast third-quarter revenue below Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, as clients dial back spending on its enterprise cloud products due to macroeconomic uncertainty.】

item.title: 泰森食品公司称供应链主管违反行为规范离职
item.description: 泰森食品公司（Tyson Foods）的首席供应链官，同时也是牛肉、猪肉和调理食品业务的监管者，在违反了公司的行为准则后离开了这家美国肉类加工企业。【原文：Tyson Foods' chief supply chain officer, who has also overseen its beef, pork and prepared foods businesses, left the U.S. meatpacker after violating the company's code of conduct, according to a statement.】

item.title: ADM 首席执行官胡安-卢西亚诺表示，ADM 的目标是在 2025 年削减 2 亿至 3 亿美元的成本
item.description: 谷物贸易商 Archer-Daniels-Midland 公司首席执行官胡安-卢西亚诺（Juan Luciano）周三表示，公司今年有望实现约 2 亿至 3 亿美元的成本削减。【原文：Grain trader Archer-Daniels-Midland's CEO Juan Luciano said on Wednesday that the company is on track to achieve about $200 million to $300 million in cost reductions this year.】

item.title: 洛克希德-马丁公司赢得价值 98 亿美元的 "爱国者 "导弹合同
item.description: 美国陆军授予洛克希德-马丁公司一份价值 98 亿美元的 "爱国者 "导弹合同。【原文：The U.S. Army awarded Lockheed Martin a $9.8 billion contract for Patriot missiles, the company said on Wednesday, as demand for the missile defense interceptor from the U.S. and foreign militaries continues.】

item.title: 消息人士称，沙特阿美计划最快于本月发行美元伊斯兰债券
item.description: 两位直接了解此事的消息人士告诉路透社，沙特阿美公司正计划最快于本月出售以美元计价的伊斯兰债券，因为在油价疲软的情况下，沙特阿美公司正努力撬动其资产负债表。【原文：Saudi Aramco is planning to sell U.S. dollar-denominated Islamic bonds as soon as this month, two sources with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters, as it seeks to lever its balance sheet amid weaker oil prices.】

item.title: 消息人士称空客 8 月交付 61 架喷气机
item.description: 业内消息人士周三称，空中客车公司 8 月份交付了 61 架喷气式飞机，使这家全球最大的飞机制造商今年迄今为止的飞机交付量达到 434 架。【原文：Airbus delivered 61 jets in August, bringing deliveries by the world's largest planemaker so far this year to 434 aircraft, industry sources said on Wednesday.】

item.title: CFTC 扫清监管障碍后，Polymarket 返回美国
item.description: 美国商品期货交易委员会（U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission）周三批准全球最大的预测市场 Polymarket 在退出美国市场三年多后在美国重新开市。【原文：The U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission on Wednesday approved Polymarket, the world's largest prediction market, to relaunch in the United States, more than three years after its exit.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：xAI财务总监下台
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周三报道，熟悉内情的人士透露，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）旗下 xAI 公司的财务总监迈克-利伯拉托尔（Mike Liberatore）在上任几个月后就离开了这家人工智能初创公司。【原文：The finance chief of Elon Musk's xAI, Mike Liberatore, has left the artificial intelligence startup after just a few months on the job, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday, people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美联储称最近几周美国经济活动和就业变化不大
item.description: 美联储周三表示，最近几周美国的经济活动和就业大多变化不大或保持不变，而物价则温和或适度上涨，这份喜忧参半的报告似乎凸显了为什么越来越多的央行决策者已表明他们对本月恢复降息持开放态度。【原文：U.S. economic activity and employment were mostly little changed or unchanged in recent weeks, while prices rose moderately or modestly, the Federal Reserve said on Wednesday, a mixed report that on the margin appeared to underscore why an increasing number of central bank policymakers have signaled their openness to resuming interest rate cuts this month.】

item.title: 巴宝莉在季度指数调整中夺回富时 100 指数席位
item.description: 全球指数提供商富时罗素（FTSE Russell）周三表示，奢侈时尚品牌巴宝莉（Burberry）将于本月晚些时候重新加入富时 100 指数，在 2024 年底退出该指数后重新成为蓝筹股基准。【原文：Luxury fashion house Burberry is set to re-enter the FTSE 100 index later this month, regaining its spot in the blue-chip benchmark after dropping out in late 2024, global index provider FTSE Russell said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 关税威胁迫在眉睫，全球制药商抢滩美国市场
item.description: 由于特朗普政府正在权衡对进口到美国的药品征收高额关税，全球制药商正争相加强其在美国的生产能力和国内库存。【原文：Global drugmakers are scrambling to shore up their U.S. manufacturing capacity and domestic inventory as the Trump administration weighs hefty tariffs on pharmaceutical imports into the country.】

item.title: Instagram 推出以 Reels 为中心的 iPad 应用程序，向 TikTok 发起挑战
item.description: Instagram 周三推出了专门的 iPad 应用程序，将其短视频功能 Reels 放在重新设计的界面中心，母公司 Meta 正在加强与 TikTok 的竞争。【原文：Instagram launched a dedicated iPad application on Wednesday, placing its short-form video feature Reels at the center of the redesigned interface as parent company Meta intensifies competition with TikTok.】

item.title: 联合利华将根据扭亏为盈战略审查前 200 个职位
item.description: 消费品巨头联合利华周三在巴克莱全球消费品大会上表示，将对其前 200 个职位进行 25% 的 "更新"。【原文：Unilever will review its top 200 roles for a 25% "refresh", the consumer goods giant said at the Barclays Global Consumer Staples Conference on Wednesday.】

item.title: Newsmax 起诉福克斯，称电视发行协议扼杀了业务
item.description: Newsmax 周三在佛罗里达州联邦法院起诉其较大的保守派新闻竞争对手福克斯公司，指控这家媒体巨头压制了美国右倾付费电视市场的竞争，使消费者的选择减少。【原文：Newsmax sued its larger conservative news rival Fox Corp in federal court in Florida on Wednesday, accusing the media giant of suppressing competition in the U.S. market for right-leaning pay TV and leaving consumers with less choice.】

item.title: 消息人士称，美国要求各国拒绝联合国船舶燃料排放协议，否则将被征收关税
item.description: 美国和欧洲官员及消息人士告诉路透社，美国已告知各国拒绝联合国的海洋燃料减排协议，否则将面临关税、签证限制和港口征税。【原文：The United States has told countries to reject a United Nations' marine fuel emissions-cutting deal or face tariffs, visa restrictions and port levies, U.S. and European officials and sources told Reuters.】

item.title: 特朗普称如果关税案败诉，美国可能不得不解除与欧盟等国的贸易协议
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周三表示，如果在最高法院关于关税合法性的案件中败诉，美国可能不得不 "解除 "与欧盟、日本和韩国等国达成的贸易协议。【原文：President Donald Trump said on Wednesday the United States might have to "unwind" trade deals it has clinched with the European Union, Japan and South Korea, among others, if it loses a Supreme Court case on the legality of tariffs.】

item.title: 美国法官质疑司法部放弃独立监督员的决定
item.description: 周三，一名美国法官举行了长达三小时的听证会，审议对司法部与波音公司达成的一项协议的反对意见，该协议允许波音公司避免因两起造成 346 人死亡的 737 MAX 飞机坠毁事故而被起诉。【原文：A U.S. judge on Wednesday held a three-hour hearing to consider objections to a deal between the Justice Department and Boeing that allows the planemaker to avoid prosecution on a charge stemming from two fatal 737 MAX plane crashes that killed 346 people.】

item.title: 美国贸易委员会收到阻止液晶显示器进口的专利申请
item.description: 美国国际贸易委员会（U.S. International Trade Commission）周三表示，它已收到一份贸易申诉，要求阻止电视机和其他设备中使用的液晶显示器的进口，据称这些产品侵犯了一家美国公司的专利。【原文：The U.S. International Trade Commission said on Wednesday it has received a trade complaint seeking to block imports of liquid crystal displays used in televisions and other devices that allegedly violate a U.S. company's patent.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长维勒鲁瓦表示，央行独立性不是低利率的障碍
item.description: 法国欧洲央行决策者弗朗索瓦-维勒鲁瓦-德-加尔豪（Francois Villeroy de Galhau）周三表示，央行的独立性并不妨碍低利率的实现，他加入了越来越多的央行官员的行列，为美联储辩护，反对白宫的干预。【原文：Central bank independence does not stand in the way of low interest rates, French ECB policymaker Francois Villeroy de Galhau said on Wednesday, joining a growing chorus of central bankers defending the Federal Reserve against White House interference.】
